basics.name: Demarcus Bell
basics.label: IT Student
basics.summary: I am an Information Technology student at UNT, expected to graduate in 2026, focusing on Cybersecurity and Networking. I am actively pursuing certifications in CompTIA, Google, and Microsoft Azure while strengthening my skills in networking, SQL, Python, JavaScript, and IDS/SIEM tools. I am passionate about penetration testing and cybersecurity, dedicated to building a solid foundation for a successful career in the field.

work.summary: Providing IT troubleshooting services, assisting clients with network issues, software problems, and hardware repairs.
highlights: Diagnosed and fixed hardware and software issues for clients.
Offered network solutions, troubleshooting, and computer repairs remotely and in person.
Managed a diverse client base with various IT needs.

volunteer.organization: University of North Texas Cybersecurity Club
volunteer.summary: Participating in cybersecurity awareness and hands-on training.
highlights: Assisted with planning and organizing cybersecurity workshops and events.
Contributed to group discussions and activities related to ethical hacking.

awards.title: Google Cybersecurity Certifications
awards.summary: Completed Google Cybersecurity Certifications in various areas, including Linux & SQL, Detection and Response, Assets Threats and Vulnerabilities, and Cybersecurity Foundations.
